intro: Hieracium lachenalii subsp. tortifolium, commonly known as the tortifolium hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Central Asia. It is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and stems that bear yellow composite flowers. The leaves are typically lanceolate or linear, with a hairy texture. It thrives in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. This subspecies is distinguished by its unique leaf morphology and is of interest in botanical studies due to its limited distribution.
